content.description:
The assassination of Julius Caesar

1 Brutus et Cassius sic C. Caesarem quasi Tarquinium

regem depulissedepello, depellere, depuli: drive out, remove regno videbantur, sed libertatem,

quam maxime restitutam voluerunt, illo ipso parricidioparricidium, -i, n.: murder of a father; assassination

perdiderunt. Igitur caede perfecta cum veteranos

5 Caesaris, nec immerito,immerito: undeservedly, without just cause timerent, statim a curia in

Capitolium confugerat. Nec illis ad ultionemultio, ultionis, f.: revenge deerat

animus, sed ducem nondum habebant.
content.question: Which aspect of the Roman concept of libertas (line 2) is most relevant to the passage?

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
